Example Sentence Sense 1: the closing ceremony of the National Political Conference.
Example Definition Sense 2: When you close something such as a door or lid or when it closes, it moves so that a hole, gap, or opening is covered.
Example Sentence Sense 2: Keep the curtains closed.
Example Definition Sense 3: When a place closes or is closed, work or activity stops there for a short period.
Example Sentence Sense 3: Shops close only on Christmas Day and New Year's Day.

Target Sense Definition: If you send someone somewhere, you tell them to go there.
Target Sense Sentence: the government's decision to send troops to the region.
Example Definition Sense 1: If you send someone somewhere, you tell them to go there.
Example Sentence Sense 1: I suggested that he rest, and sent him for an X-ray.
Example Definition Sense 2: When you send someone something, you arrange for it to be taken and delivered to them, for example by post.
Example Sentence Sense 2: More than half a million sheep are sent from Britain to Europe for slaughter every year.
Example Definition Sense 3: To send someone or something into a particular state means to cause them to go into or be in that state.
Example Sentence Sense 3: before civil war and famine sent the country plunging into anarchy.

Target Sense Definition: When a public building, factory, or company opens or when someone opens it, it starts operating for the first time.
Target Sense Sentence: They are planning to open a factory in Eastern Europe.
Example Definition Sense 1: When a public building, factory, or company opens or when someone opens it, it starts operating for the first time.
Example Sentence Sense 1: The original station opened in 1754.
Example Definition Sense 2: If an event such as a meeting or discussion opens with a particular activity or if a particular activity opens an event, that activity is the first thing that happens or is dealt with. You can also say that someone such as a speaker or singer opens by doing a particular thing.
Example Sentence Sense 2: Pollard opened the conversation with some small talk.
Example Definition Sense 3: When a shop, office, or public building opens or is opened, its doors are unlocked and the public can go in.
Example Sentence Sense 3: a gang of three who'd apparently been lying in wait for him to open the shop.

Target Sense Definition: If an organization offers something such as a service or product, it provides it.
Target Sense Sentence: We have been successful because we are offering a quality service.
Example Definition Sense 1: If an organization offers something such as a service or product, it provides it.
Example Sentence Sense 1: Eagle Star offers a 10% discount to the over-55s.
Example Definition Sense 2: If you offer a particular amount of money for something, you say that you will pay that much to buy it.
Example Sentence Sense 2: It was his custom in buying real estate to offer a rather low price.
Example Definition Sense 3: If you offer someone something such as love or friendship, you show them that you feel that way towards them.
Example Sentence Sense 3: It must be better to be able to offer them love and security.

Target Sense Definition: If someone runs for office in an election, they take part as a candidate.
Target Sense Sentence: It was only last February that he announced he would run for president.
Example Definition Sense 1: If someone runs for office in an election, they take part as a candidate.
Example Sentence Sense 1: It is no easy job to run against John Glenn, Ohio's Democratic senator.
Example Definition Sense 2: When you run, you move more quickly than when you walk, for example because you are in a hurry to get somewhere, or for exercise.
Example Sentence Sense 2: Antonia ran to meet them.
Example Definition Sense 3: If you run something such as a business or an activity, you are in charge of it or you organize it.
Example Sentence Sense 3: Is this any way to run a country?

Target Sense Definition: If you sweep an area of floor or ground, you push dirt or rubbish off it using a brush with a long handle.
Target Sense Sentence: Norma picked up the broom and began sweeping.
Example Definition Sense 1: If you sweep an area of floor or ground, you push dirt or rubbish off it using a brush with a long handle.
Example Sentence Sense 1: The owner of the store was sweeping his floor when I walked in.
Example Definition Sense 2: If someone sweeps into a place, they walk into it in a proud, confident way, often when they are angry.
Example Sentence Sense 2: She swept into the conference room.
Example Definition Sense 3: If your arm or hand sweeps in a particular direction, or if you sweep it there, it moves quickly and smoothly in that direction.
Example Sentence Sense 3: Daniels swept his arm over his friend's shoulder.

Target Sense Definition: You use say in expressions such as I would just like to say to introduce what you are actually saying, or to indicate that you are expressing an opinion or admitting a fact. If you state that you can't say something or you wouldn't say something, you are indicating in a polite or indirect way that it is not the case.
Target Sense Sentence: I must say that rather shocked me, too.
Example Definition Sense 1: You use say in expressions such as I would just like to say to introduce what you are actually saying, or to indicate that you are expressing an opinion or admitting a fact. If you state that you can't say something or you wouldn't say something, you are indicating in a polite or indirect way that it is not the case.
Example Sentence Sense 1: I would just like to say that this is the most hypocritical thing I have ever heard in my life.
Example Definition Sense 2: When you say something, you speak words.
Example Sentence Sense 2: I packed and said goodbye to Charlie.
Example Definition Sense 3: You can mention the contents of a piece of writing by mentioning what it says or what someone says in it.
Example Sentence Sense 3: The report says there is widespread and routine torture of political prisoners in the country.

Target Sense Definition: If you talk to someone, you have a conversation with them. You can also say that two people talk.
Target Sense Sentence: We talked and laughed a great deal.
Example Definition Sense 1: If you talk to someone, you have a conversation with them. You can also say that two people talk.
Example Sentence Sense 1: I talked to him yesterday.
Example Definition Sense 2: If one group of people talks to another, or if two groups talk, they have formal discussions in order to do a deal or produce an agreement.
Example Sentence Sense 2: We're talking to some people about opening an office in London.
Example Definition Sense 3: If you talk to someone, you tell them about the things that are worrying you. You can also say that two people talk.
Example Sentence Sense 3: We need to talk alone.

Target Sense Definition: If something brings a particular feeling, situation, or quality, it makes people experience it or have it.
Target Sense Sentence: He called on the United States to play a more effective role in bringing peace to the region.
Example Definition Sense 1: If something brings a particular feeling, situation, or quality, it makes people experience it or have it.
Example Sentence Sense 1: He brought to the job not just considerable experience but passionate enthusiasm.
Example Definition Sense 2: If you bring someone or something with you when you come to a place, they come with you or you have them with you.
Example Sentence Sense 2: Remember to bring an apron or an old shirt to protect your clothes.
Example Definition Sense 3: To bring someone or something into a particular state or condition means to cause them to be in that state or condition.
Example Sentence Sense 3: They have brought down income taxes.
